sen.j: 佐々木 秀義（ささき ひでよし）は、平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: Hideyoshi SASAKI was a Japanese military commander in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 源頼朝の挙兵を助けた佐々木四兄弟の父。
sen.e: He was a father of four brothers of Sasaki family, who fought for MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
He was a father of the Sasaki four brothers, who fought for MINAMOTO no Yoritomo in raising his army.
sen.cmt: ・訂正four brothers of Sasaki family→the Sasaki four brothers・追加in raising his army
sen.e: He was a father of the Sasaki four brothers, who fought for MINAMOTO no Yoritomo in raising his army.

sen.j: 近江国蒲生郡佐々木荘を領し、秀義の伯母は藤原秀衡に嫁ぎ、自身は源為義の娘を妻としている。
sen.e: He possessed Sasakinosho (Sasaki's estate) in Gamo District, Omi Province; his aunt married FUJIWARA no Hidehira, and he himself took a daughter of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi to his wife.

sen.j: この頃の佐々木氏が有力武士であった事を伺わせる。
sen.e: This shows that the Sasaki clan was a dominant samurai at that time.

sen.j: 保元元年（1156年）に崇徳天皇と後白河天皇が争った保元の乱で、秀義は天皇方の源義朝に属して勝利した。
sen.e: In the Hogen War in which Cloistered Emperor Sutoku fought with Emperor Goshirakawa, Hideyoshi fought under MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo on the Emperor's side, and won the battle.
sen.cmt: 「崇徳天皇」は「崇徳上皇」の誤りと思われます

sen.j: 平治元年（1159年）の平治の乱でも義朝に属し、義朝の長男である悪源太源義平に従い戦うが、義朝方は敗れ、伯母の夫である秀衡を頼って奥州へと落ち延びる。
sen.e: In the Heiji War of 1159, he also fought under Yoshitomo, following Akugenta (by-name) MINAMOTO no Yoshihira, Yoshitomo's eldest son; however, the Yoshitomo's side was defeated, and he fled to Oshu, asking Hidehira, his aunt's husband, for help.

sen.j: 途中、相模国の渋谷重国に引き止められ、その庇護を受け娘を娶り五男の義清をもうけ、20年を渋谷荘に送った。
sen.e: On the way, Shigekuni SHIBUYA kept him at the Sagami Province to give him shelter; he married Shibuya's daughter, having children including Yoshikiyo (fifth son), and remained in Shibuyanosho (Shibuya's estate) for 20 years.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）に源頼朝が伊豆国で平氏打倒の兵を挙げる際、伊勢平氏の家人大庭景親から頼朝討伐の密事を聞き、子の定綱を使いに出して頼朝に危急を知らせる。
sen.e: When MINAMOTO no Yoritomo rose an army against the Taira clan in the Izu Province in 1180, he heard an alleged plot to topple Yoritomo from Kagechika OBA, a retainer of the Ise-Heishi (Taira clan); he sent his son Sadatsuna to inform Yoritomo the impending danger.

sen.j: 定綱、経高、盛綱、高綱を頼朝挙兵に従わせ、その功により本領を安堵され、佐々木荘へと戻る。
sen.e: He made Sadatsuna, Tsunetaka, Moritsuna, and Takatsuna join the forces of Yoritomo; for this reason, he was approved of his right to have an inherited estate and returned to Sasakinosho.

sen.j: 元暦元年（1184年）7月の三日平氏の乱 (平安時代)において、末子の佐々木義清と共に反乱鎮圧に赴いた。
sen.e: In Mikka Heishi no ran (the three-day rebellion of the Taira clan) in 1184 (Heian period), he set out to subdue the rebellion with his youngest son Yoshikiyo.

sen.j: 平家継・平信兼らの率いる伊賀国・伊勢国の平家方残党と甲賀郡上野村で戦い90余人を討った後、戦死した。
sen.e: In Ueno village, Koga District, he fought against the survivors of the Heike clan of the Iga and Ise Provinces led by TAIRA no Ietsugu and TAIRA no Nobukane respectively; he defeated more than 90 people, but died at the battle.
